Your consciousness slips away as you fall fasterdown, down, down.The next thing you know, you're floating in air.In the soft, reddish light you can see that you arein a cavern, drifting toward the ceiling—or is it thefloor? In a flash you realize what has happened—you've fallen to a point where gravity above youis almost equal to gravity beneath you! You brush against a firm surface—a wall thatfeels like clay. You cling to it for a moment. Thenyou're floating again, drifting slowly down. Youbegin to lose your fear as you realize that gravityhere is so weak that you can fall mile after milewithout being hurt After a while you begin torelax and enjoy drifting through a fantastic twi-light world. You only wish it weren't so hot! Clos-ing your eyes, you try to pretend that you aresafely home in bed
